comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: New York Republican politician, b. 1860.  Served on the Committee on Legislation, State Department of Agriculture and Markets; president New York State Agricultural Society.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A 1910 biographical sketch from "New York state men : biographic studies and character portraits, Volume 2 By Frederick Simon Hills" books.google.com/books?id=QlxKAAAAYAAJ&dq=c.%20fred%2... "C FRED BOSHART Agriculturist Member of Assembly from Lewis County was born at Lowville Lewis County NY September 17 1860 son of Charles D Boshart farmer and Margaret Quackenbushl Boshart His preparatory education was received at Lowville Academy and in 1884 he was graduated from Cornell University with the degree of Bachelor of Agriculture Mr Boshart has for many years been prominent in the Republican politics of Lewis County In 1904 and 1905 he was Superv1sor of Lowville and in 1905 he was elected to the State Assembly to which he was re elected in 1906 1907 1908 and 1909 Since 1907 he has been chairman of the Assembly Committee on Agriculture and has also served as a member of the Committees on Ways and Means Taxation and Retrenchment Canals and Labor and Industry In 1907 he was appointed a member of the joint legislative commission to investigate the general subject of taxation Mr Boshart is a director and vice president of the First National Bank of Lowville member Lowville Lodge No 134 F & AM Watertown Com mandery No 11 KT Media Temple AAONMS Lowville Lodge No 759 IOOF and of the Lowville Club He married Clara Amelia Smiley October 20 1887 Mrs Boshart is a daughter of Amos V Smiley of Lowville editor and former Member of Assembly Children Charles R and Margaret A Address Lowville." ... In his later life, he served several terms as the president of the New York State Agriculturat Society and held some other agriculture-related posts in state government.. He died in 1928. Lengthy obituary at: fultonhistory.com/Process%20small/Newspapers/Lowvile%20Ny...(406).PDF [New York Times (AP) obituary incorrectly states that he was State Commissioner of Agriculture.]
